title: Hi guys
body: Hi goyss

title: Implement sorting on StarsListFragment
body:
## Sortable Star List

### Overiew of Changes
---
1. Added arrow Vector Assets that will be the sorting indicators.
2. Added a TextView above the Star ListView that is clickable and controls the sort direction.
3. Added sorting logic to sort the list of stations by name.

## Notes

Addresses issue https://github.com/ojacquemart/vlilleChecker/issues/1 
** I know the UI might change, but I feel this is a good starting point! **

title: Feature/analytics
body:
## Vlille Checker Anaytics

### Overview of Changes

1. Integrated `Google Analytics v4` as a dependency, and configured the build to include our ID.
2. Created a new manager class, `Analytics Manager` that handles all calls to Google Analytics.
3. Added calls to send Analytics calls to AnalyticsManager from every visible Fragment and Activity.

### Strategy

I tried to design this in a way that was intutive and was easy for you to make additions to. Ideally, you can just add more methods for different analytics you wish to capture (i.e. something besides an event or screen view)

### Exampes of Analytic Calls

| Metric      | Example                                                                      |
|-------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Screen View | ```AnalyticsManager.trackScreenView("About Screen");```                      |
| Click Event | ```AnalyticsManager.trackEvent("Home Screen", "Settings Tab Clicked", "Click");``` |

title: "passive" location provider requires ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission.

title: Improve geo location
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
From an user:

"Géo-localisation lente. Une fois centré sur la position, le cercle d'incertitude précédent ne disparait pas (image grisée). En déplaçant le curseur (vers la destination p.e.) les bornes n'apparaissent pas. Seules celles précédemment affichées sont sur la carte. Bon courage. LG G4 sous Android 6."

title: Improve transpole failover
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Sometimes, it seems like transpole is down.
It could be useful to display a message to notify that the issue comes from transpole and not the app.

title: Add marker for express stations
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
There are now "express" stations like at the Lille flandres stations.
It could be useful to have a marker like for the stations which allow credit card.
This is a suggestion from an user.

An express station has a card scanner at each terminal.

3. Click on Stations Around Me
4. Orientation Change

title: Station id should not be visible by default

body: User request

title: Last update time is always updated
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: When updating the stations list, the last update time in the settings is always changed. It should display the time when new stations were inserted.

title: Update process log android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConstraintException
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Update process is buggy. The process gets remote vlille stations. To extract new stations, the List#removeAll method is called in order to keep only the new remote stations comparing with the local list stored into sqlite.

Since  the Station#equals implementation uses `name.equals(other.getName)` and getName concats `id` and `name`, the method is buggy. It was done this way in order to reduce changes when adding the feature to display the station id into the list view.

Finally, the process is trying to persist the list with elements that should already exist

title: F-Droid update
body:
Hi,

I use your app since OpenBike retired few months ago.
I installed it via F-Droid but it wasn't updated since a while.

Could you please provide the new version on F-Droid too?

Anyway, thanks for your work, you're saving time of some VLille users.

title: Make list sortable
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
Add the ability to sort the list of the favorite stations.
By default sort by ascending.

It could be done with a drag & drop list.
